title: Bain Capital delays Retail Zoo IPO
text:
Private equity firm Bain Capital has pulled an initial public offering of Boost Juice owner Retail Zoo.

Retail Zoo was lining up for a November listing and its brokers had spent the past few weeks introducing the company to fund managers.

However, owner Bain has pulled the proposed listing citing IPO market conditions.

It comes only one week after Latitude Financial Group cancelled its proposed sharemarket float and a fortnight after gas services business MPC Kinetic scrapped its listing plans.

As Street Talk reported earlier this week, Retail Zoo's brokers were believed to be seeking cornerstone backers at 15-times forecast profit but fund managers pushed back against the proposed deal.
description: Private equity firm Bain Capital has pulled an initial public offering of Boost Juice owner Retail Zoo.
